DOC.brief_summary: Cerebral microemboli (ME) are frequently generated during major orthopaedic surgery. The primary objective of this study was applying novel transcranial Doppler (TCD) ultrasound software algorithm to quantify (ME load/15 minutes) and qualify (particulate vs. gaseous) ME, detected as high-intensity transient signals (HITS) in both middle cerebral arteries (MCAs) before and after orthopaedic surgery.
DOC.brief_title: Tissue Oxygen Index and Pulsatility Index in Orthopedic Surgery: a NIRS and TCD Pilot Trial
DOC.criteria: hip prosthesis knee prosthesis shoulder prosthesis spine surgery severe valvular heart defect acute neurological disorder
